At about 22 weeks, your baby 
becomes covered in a very 
fine,	soft	hair	called	lanugo.	
We don’t know what this hair 
is for, but it is thought that 
it may keep the baby at the 
right temperature. The lanugo 
disappears before birth or 
soon after.
Between 16 and 22 weeks, you 
will usually feel your baby move 
for	the	first	time.	If	this	is	your	
second baby, you may feel it 
earlier	–	at	about	16–18	weeks.	
At	first,	you	feel	a	fluttering	or	
bubbling, or
